question: What is the capital of Australia?
answer_with_citations: The capital of Australia is Canberra. [1]

evidence.title: Australia — Capital city
evidence.snippet: Canberra is the capital city of Australia. It is Australia's largest inland city.

question: In what year did the Berlin Wall fall?

evidence.title: Berlin Wall — 1989 opening
evidence.snippet: On 9 November 1989, the Berlin Wall was opened, leading to its fall and the end of the barrier.

question: How many bytes are in a kilobyte in the SI standard?
answer_with_citations: In the SI standard, 1 kilobyte (kB) equals 1,000 bytes. [1]

evidence.title: Decimal vs binary prefixes
evidence.snippet: In the International System of Units (SI), the prefix kilo (k) means 10^3; thus 1 kilobyte (kB) is 1,000 bytes.

question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet and why?
reference_answer: Mars, because iron oxide (rust) on its surface gives it a reddish appearance.
answer_with_citations: Mars is called the Red Planet because iron oxide (rust) on its surface gives it a reddish color. [1]

evidence.title: Mars — appearance
evidence.snippet: Mars is often called the 'Red Planet' because iron oxide prevalent on its surface gives it a reddish appearance.

question: Who wrote the novel 'Pride and Prejudice'?
answer_with_citations: ‘Pride and Prejudice’ was written by Jane Austen. [1]

evidence.title: Pride and Prejudice — authorship
evidence.snippet: Pride and Prejudice is a romantic novel of manners written by Jane Austen.

question: What is the chemical formula for table salt?
answer_with_citations: Table salt is sodium chloride, with chemical formula NaCl. [1]

evidence.title: Sodium chloride — formula
evidence.snippet: Sodium chloride, commonly known as salt, has the chemical formula NaCl.

question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
answer_with_citations: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth. [1]

evidence.title: World oceans — size
evidence.snippet: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest of Earth's oceanic divisions.

question: Which gas do plants primarily absorb for photosynthesis?
answer_with_citations: Plants primarily absorb carbon dioxide (CO2) for photosynthesis. [1]

evidence.title: Photosynthesis — inputs
evidence.snippet: Photosynthesis uses carbon dioxide and water, converting them into sugars and oxygen using light energy.

question: What is the boiling point of water at 1 atmosphere of pressure in degrees Celsius?

evidence.title: Water — phase change
evidence.snippet: At standard atmospheric pressure (1 atm), the boiling point of water is 100 °C.

question: Which is heavier: a pound of feathers or a pound of iron?
reference_answer: Neither; they weigh the same (one pound).
answer_with_citations: Neither is heavier; a pound of feathers and a pound of iron both weigh one pound. [1]

evidence.title: Units of weight — pound
evidence.snippet: A pound is a unit of weight; one pound of any material has the same weight: one pound.
